Each index in an index path represents the index into an array of children from one node in the tree to another, deeper, node.

# IndexPath

**Structure**

A list of indexes that together represent the path to a specific location in a tree of nested arrays.

## Declaration

```swift
struct IndexPath
```

## Overview

Each index in an index path represents the index into an array of children from one node in the tree to another, deeper, node.

## Creating Index Paths

- **init()**: Creates an empty index path.
- **init(index:)**: Creates an index path with a single element.
- **init(arrayLiteral:)**: Creates an index path from an array literal.
- **init(indexes:)**: Creates an index path from an array of elements.
- **init(indexes:)**: Creates an index path from a sequence of integers.

## Working with Special Node Names

- **item**: The value of the item element of the index path.
- **row**: The value of the row element of the index path.
- **section**: The value of the section element of the index path.

## Adding Nodes

- **+(_:_:)**: Combines the elements of two index paths into a single index path.
- **+=(_:_:)**: Appends the elements of another index path to this index path.

## Selecting Nodes

- **append(_:)**: Appends the nodes of another index path to this one.
- **append(_:)**: Appends an array of elements to this index path as additional nodes.
- **append(_:)**: Appends a single element to this index path as a new node.
- **appending(_:)**: Returns a new index path containing the elements of this one plus the given element.
- **appending(_:)**: Returns a new index path containing the elements of this one plus those of another index path.
- **appending(_:)**: Returns a new index path containing the elements of this one plus an array of additional elements.
- **compare(_:)**: Compares this index path to another in depth-first traversal order.
- **dropLast()**: Return a new index path containing all but the last element.

## Excluding Nodes

- **dropLast()**: Return a new index path containing all but the last element.

## Comparing Index Paths

- **compare(_:)**: Compares this index path to another in depth-first traversal order.

## Using Reference Types

- **NSIndexPath**: A list of indexes that together represent the path to a specific location in a tree of nested arrays.

## Initializers

- **init(item:section:)**: Creates an index path that references an item in a particular section.
- **init(item:section:)**: Initialize for use with `NSCollectionView`.
- **init(row:section:)**: Creates an index path that references a row in a particular section.

## Instance Properties

- **item**: The item of this index path, when used with `NSCollectionView`.
- **section**: The section of this index path, when used with `NSCollectionView`.

## Indexes

- **IndexSet**: A collection of unique integer values that represent the indexes of elements in another collection.

## Conforms To

- BidirectionalCollection
- Collection
- Comparable
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- Hashable
- MutableCollection
- RandomAccessCollection
- ReferenceConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- Sequence
